body:
Two things:
Use

``````
    ```
``````

 around your output, it makes it easier to read.
You're missing `glibconfih.h`, look at the end of the build output. How to get it depends on your Linux distro.

For future reference, when a build fails, check the first couple lines and the last couple lines, because that's where the important error would be

@capouch seems like an issue with `pkg-config` step, somehow files are being included from `lib64` dir `I/usr/src/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib64/glib-2.0/include` which shouldnt exist.  Can you paste the output of running the following command in electron folder

```
â¯ ./tools/linux/pkg-config-wrapper ./vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot x64 lib --cflags libnotify
```

Which distro might this be ?

```
$ ./tools/linux/pkg-config-wrapper ./vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot x64 lib --cflags libnotify
-pthread -I./vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/include/gdk-pixbuf-2.0 -I./vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/include/libpng16 -I./vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/include/glib-2.0 -I./vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib64/glib-2.0/include
```

It's Slackware-64-current, installed during December 2015.

> /usr/bin/ld: this linker was not configured to use sysroots

Your linker doesn't support sysroot, I suggest upgrading the build toolchains in your system by installing latest clang.

@deepak1556 Can you suggest how I could compensate for this issue, which is still preventing me from building electron?  I have been able to build on CentoOS, but not Slackware, and I don't have the chops to figure out where in the build system to remove the errant #include.

I havnt tried building on slackware, my concern is how much does `pkg-config` respect `PKG_CONFIG_LIBDIR` vs `PKG_CONFIG_PATH` on this system. You could try setting `PKG_CONFIG_PATH` to the following.

``` shell
$ export ELECTRON_SYSROOT=/path/to/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot
$ export PKG_CONFIG_PATH=$ELECTRON_SYSROOT/usr/lib/pkgconfig:$ELECTRON_SYSROOT/usr/share/pkgconfig
```

If the glib-2.0.pc in sysroot got picked up everything should work fine. I am not sure why it doesnt even when `PKG_CONFIG_LIBDIR` is specified. I will try to setup a slackware sometime in the next few days.

I have the same problem on Gentoo

```
$ ./script/build.py -c D
ninja: Entering directory `out/D'
[1/117] SOLINK lib/libnode.so
FAILED: if [ ! -e lib/libnode.so -o ! -e lib/libnode.so.TOC ]; then /home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/llvm-build/Release+Asserts/bin/clang++ -shared -Wl,-z,noexecstack -Wl,--whole-archive  -Wl,--no-whole-archive -pthread --sysroot=/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot -L/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu -Wl,-rpath-link=/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu -L/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu -Wl,-rpath-link=/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu -L/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/4.6 -Wl,-rpath-link=/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/4.6 -L/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib -Wl,-rpath-link=/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib -m64 -o lib/libnode.so -Wl,-soname=libnode.so @lib/libnode.so.rsp && { readelf -d lib/libnode.so | grep SONAME ; nm -gD -f p lib/libnode.so | cut -f1-2 -d' '; } > lib/libnode.so.TOC; else /home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/llvm-build/Release+Asserts/bin/clang++ -shared -Wl,-z,noexecstack -Wl,--whole-archive  -Wl,--no-whole-archive -pthread --sysroot=/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot -L/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu -Wl,-rpath-link=/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu -L/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu -Wl,-rpath-link=/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu -L/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/4.6 -Wl,-rpath-link=/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/4.6 -L/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib -Wl,-rpath-link=/home/evgeny/dev/electron/vendor/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot/usr/lib -m64 -o lib/libnode.so -Wl,-soname=libnode.so @lib/libnode.so.rsp && { readelf -d lib/libnode.so | grep SONAME ; nm -gD -f p lib/libnode.so | cut -f1-2 -d' '; } > lib/libnode.so.tmp && if ! cmp -s lib/libnode.so.tmp lib/libnode.so.TOC; then mv lib/libnode.so.tmp lib/libnode.so.TOC ; fi; fi
/usr/bin/ld: this linker was not configured to use sysroots
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.
```

Any ideas what can be wrong? No luck with suggestions by @deepak1556 :(
